@graph.caption: Dark Chocolate Halloween Cookies on cooling rack next to black plastic spiders and snakes

@graph.name: Dark Chocolate Halloween Cookies - Simply Happy Foodie
Dark Chocolate Halloween Cookies
@graph.description: Dark Chocolate Halloween Cookies make a spooky and tasty treat! The dark as night chocolate cookies are the perfect backdrop for the pumpkin orange candies. Serve these chocolate Halloween cookies to all your ghouls and boys!
recipeIngredient: 2 sticks Unsalted Butter ((1 cup) room temperature)
3/4 cup Dark Cocoa Powder ((such as Hershey's Special Dark®))
1 1/4 cups Orange Colored M&M's® ((or other orange candy coated chocolate candies))

recipeInstructions.text: I like to use my stand mixer for this recipe as the dough gets very thick.
recipeInstructions.name: I like to use my stand mixer for this recipe as the dough gets very thick.

recipeInstructions.text: In a mixing bowl, cream together the butter and sugars.
recipeInstructions.name: In a mixing bowl, cream together the butter and sugars.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix in the eggs and vanilla.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix in the eggs and vanilla.

recipeInstructions.text: In a separate bowl, add the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and espresso powder, if using. Mix together well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a separate bowl, add the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and espresso powder, if using. Mix together well.

recipeInstructions.text: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: add the dark chocolate chips and mix them in.
recipeInstructions.name: add the dark chocolate chips and mix them in.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the M&M's® and mix them in gently so they don't break. If a few break that's fine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the M&M's® and mix them in gently so they don't break. If a few break that's fine.

recipeInstructions.text: Line 2 cookie baking sheets with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Line 2 cookie baking sheets with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a 2 Tbsp ice cream scoop to scoop the dough onto the cookie sheets. Don't press them down, just leave them like that. Make 3 rows of 4. You should get 24 cookies.
recipeInstructions.name: Use a 2 Tbsp ice cream scoop to scoop the dough onto the cookie sheets. Don't press them down, just leave them like that. Make 3 rows of 4. You should get 24 cookies.

recipeInstructions.text: If you need to, gently press extra M&M's onto the cookies before baking so that bright orange candy shows!
recipeInstructions.name: If you need to, gently press extra M&M's onto the cookies before baking so that bright orange candy shows!

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in a 350° (F) oven for 8-10 minutes, or until the cookies are done/firm around the edges when pressed. They will still be soft in the middle and just a little puffed up.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in a 350° (F) oven for 8-10 minutes, or until the cookies are done/firm around the edges when pressed. They will still be soft in the middle and just a little puffed up.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven and cool cookies in the pans for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven and cool cookies in the pans for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling.
